title: Mortgage Bond Sales Surged in October
sub_head: Non-agency deals and credit-risk transfer bonds push issuance to near record levels
body:
Mortgage companies in the U.S. issued $21 billion of mortgage-backed bonds in October, the second heaviest month of borrowing since the 2008-09 financial crisis, according to research by Bank of America Corp.
One reason: It is cheaper for many companies to borrow in the “private-label” market than to issue bonds guaranteed by government-sponsored enterprises Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.
